title: Manchester City and the perils of playing out from the back – Football Weekly
text:
Max Rushden , Barry Glendenning , Sean Ingle and John Brewin discuss a shock at Carrow Road, more Arsenal defensive woes, a Seedorf scores in Scotland, a 16-year-old scores for Barcelona and Daniel Farke lookalikes

Join the conversation on Facebook, Twitter and email.

We take a look back at the weekend of football just gone, starting with Norwich City’s shock 3-2 win over reigning champions Manchester City. Liverpool, meanwhile, keep up their 100% record – we try to work out when they’ll first drop points.

Arsenal threw away a two-goal lead at Watford in spectacular fashion, contriving to concede twice, but threatening to concede many more. Chelsea beat Wolves 5-2 with five English goals – Wolves still yet to go ahead in a league game this season.

We round up the rest of the Premier League, the Football League, the WSL and action north of the border, before turning our attention to mainland Europe. We speak to Sid Lowe about 16-year-old Ansu Fati and just how much some newspapers are getting carried away after a couple of very good performances. And we also hear from Nicky Bandini on the latest incidences of racism in Italian football.

Back on Thursday!
